head.title: Imagine Prep's Remote Learning Program - News and Announcements - Imagine Prep Surprise

meta.content: Tuition-free, 6-12 charter school, providing a rigorous Cambridge curriculum, character/leadership development, extracurricular and athletic opportunities in Surprise, Arizona.
Temporary Grading Guidelines for our Remote Learning Plan

link.title: Imagine Prep Surprise: News and Announcements

div.aria-label: Imagine Prep's Remote Learning Program News Post

span.style: display: block; text-align: right; cursor: pointer;

div.p: Temporary Grading Guidelines for our Remote Learning Plan

span.p: As you know, the Arizona Governor and State Board of Education have asked schools to provide Remote Learning opportunities to Arizona students during these unprecedented school closures in response to the Covid-19 Pandemic. The State Board has also granted authority for schools to consider the successful completion of these Remote Learning opportunities as grounds for determining if a student meets the minimum course of study and competency requirements specific to each course.

Imagine Prep has rolled out our Remote Learning Plan in three Phases. In our plan, we shared some basic expectations, including that students would receive traditional grades for the work they were completing. It is important that we provide students with the tools and opportunities that best prepares them to progress forward in their educational journey.

Overall, Imagine Prep’s use of grades in our Remote Learning context provides teachers and students valuable feedback about a student’s progress and performance; however, we have designed measures to minimize punitive practices that may negatively impact a student’s traditional progression. For one, teachers have pared down their curriculum to emphasize specific elements beneficial for advancement.
Below are some temporary Grading Guidelines for our Remote Learning Plan:

ul.li: Students will not experience more than two graded assignments per week, per core subject area (Math, English, Science, and Social Studies). Teachers are permitted to provide additional practice assignments as necessary, but these assignments will not be calculated in a student’s final grade.
All Quarter 4 graded assignments will carry the same weight.
Students will be permitted to submit work late or re-do assignments at each teacher’s discretion. ALL teachers understand that we are working under the mantra of grace over grades.
There will be no Final Exams this semester.
For high school students, 4th Quarter grade will be averaged with their 3rd Quarter grade to determine their semester grade.

High school students are expected to earn their elective quarter credits through the completion of their Independent Projects due on May 8th as spelled out in Imagine Prep’s Phase 3 Remote Learning document.

If a student completes all required assignments, they cannot receive a 4th Quarter grade lower than their previous Quarter’s performance thus working as a safety net for students actively engaging in their education and coursework.
PowerSchool should be utilized as the primary tool to check on student progress and as always, we encourage direct communication with your child’s teachers when necessary.

span.p: It is important to note, that a student’s Remote Learning performance will be considered in next year’s course placement, intervention or tutoring placement, and summer school enrollment.

We understand that the current Pandemic affects our families in different ways. As a result, we have built systems to provide additional supports and check-ins for students and families in need. Our staff wants to do everything possible to support student learning. Should you need additional assistance, please do not hesitate to reach out to myself or our staff.
We are here for our students and parents!

hr.p: Each week, students will experience two lessons in English, Mathematics, Science, and Social Studies, and Spanish (for HS students currently enrolled in Spanish I or II). Through Google Classroom, students will be presented videos of instruction, activities to practice new skills, and assignments that will be submitted for a grade. Along with those activities, teachers will be available virtually for Office Hours to ensure student understanding and support. Please see the description of each component below:

table.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: small; border-collapse: collapse; border: none;

td.style: font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; margin: 0px; width: 623px; border: 1pt solid black; padding: 0in 5.4pt; vertical-align: top;

strong.u: Videos of Instruction - Asynchronous (on your own time):

ul.li:
Lessons will be accessed through each teacher’s Google Classroom.
Imagine Prep Google Classroom/Zoom Directory
Google Classroom Guide for Parents
Lessons can be accessed throughout the week (at the convenience of the student).

Students can expect 2 virtual lessons per subject, per week.
Virtual lessons will not exceed 25 minutes, but students may require more time to complete activities and assignments.

td.style: font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; margin: 0px; width: 623px; border-right: 1pt solid black; border-bottom: 1pt solid black; border-left: 1pt solid black; border-image: initial; border-top: none; padding: 0in 5.4pt; vertical-align: top;

ul.li:
Teachers will provide Live Office Hour support through a virtual platform called Zoom.
A Guide for using Zoom (Virtual Meeting Platform)
See Google Classroom/Zoom Directory for Meeting ID numbers.

Each teacher has 3 scheduled Live Office Hours each week.
A Live Office Hours Schedule is provided by grade level:
6th Grade Virtual Office Hours Schedule
7th Grade Virtual Office Hours Schedule
8th Grade Virtual Office Hours Schedule
The first Live Office Hour session of the week, teachers will outline learning and assignment expectations for the week.
In addition to scheduled sessions, students may seek scheduled support calls with their teachers.
Office Hours are not required, but highly encouraged.
Students with disabilities will be contacted by their Special Education teacher and provided additional support services.

td.style: font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; margin: 0px; width: 623px; border-right: 1pt solid black; border-bottom: 1pt solid black; border-left: 1pt solid black; border-image: initial; border-top: none; padding: 0in 5.4pt; height: 9px; vertical-align: top;

ul.li: Students are expected to log in and engage in all recorded lessons each week.
2 graded assignments per week for English and Mathematics

li.span: 1 graded assignment per week for Science and Social Studies

ul.li: 2 assignments per week for English, Mathematics, Science, Social Studies, and Spanish (if applicable).

These assignments will be due on Friday by 4pm of each week and will be entered into PowerSchool for a grade.
Additional educational activities related to the new learning may be assigned as practice, but not graded (i.e., discussion board posts, practice problems, additional videos, etc.)
Assignments for students with disabilities will be modified as required by students’ Individual Education Plans.
